      • StringCoder

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(byte[] data)
        This method encodes the byte array into a String in base 64 in a way similar to the specification given by the RFC 1521 (5.2). However it is NOT compatible with it. Specifically it avoids the problematic / and + characters which would need to be escaped in URIs, also it does not produce results of length multiple of 4 by omitting trailing = characters that do not store any bits
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array that needs to be encoded
        Returns:
        the encoded String

      • isValidCode

        public static boolean isValidCode(java.lang.String code)
        Checks to see if the supplied code is something that could have been produced by the encode() method.

      • decode

        public static byte[] decode(java.lang.String code)
        Decodes the given base 64 encoded string into the original byte array.
